Entities.Name: Cancer Imaging Finding
Entities.Definition: A radiologic observation suggestive of malignancy (e.g., mass, lesion, nodule) that is considered a candidate metastatic site.
Entities.SampleData: New segment VI and segment II/III hepatic hypodense [lesions] are suspicious for metastases.

Entities.Name: Anatomic Descriptor
Entities.Definition: Modifiers of anatomical locations that provide spatial granularity (e.g., segments, lobes, quadrants).
Entities.SampleData: New [segment VI] and [segment II/III] hepatic hypodense lesions are suspicious for metastases.

Entities.Name: Body Part
Entities.Definition: The organ or region of the body being described in the imaging report.

Entities.Name: Assertion Status
Entities.Definition: The level of certainty that a cancer imaging finding is metastatic, assigned as definite, probable, indeterminate, or low.
Entities.SampleData: Stable left upper lobe metastasis [Assertion: definite].

Dataset.Name: Singapore National Cancer Centre Radiology Report Corpus
Dataset.Description: Includes 4,522 de-identified CT radiology reports from 550 patients with 14 cancer types for model development. Extended to 53,838 CT reports from 6,555 patients for cohort analysis.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Entities were annotated using the INCEpTION platform. Assertion status was labeled using a 4-level Likert scale. A relation extraction (RE) model mapped relationships between cancer imaging findings and body parts. Postprocessing normalized anatomical terms into a set of 63 standardized terms (e.g., adrenal â†’ adrenal gland).
